trans-unit.source: Set Queue Service Properties
trans-unit.target: Set Queue Service Properties

trans-unit.source: Set Queue Service Properties
trans-unit.target: Set Queue Service Properties

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Set Queue Service Properties</languageKeyword> operation sets properties for a storage account’s Queue service endpoint, including properties for <link xlink:href="f6481e74-78db-4964-b149-16e09173f5e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Analytics</link> and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Set Queue Service Properties</languageKeyword> operation sets properties for a storage account’s Queue service endpoint, including properties for <link xlink:href="f6481e74-78db-4964-b149-16e09173f5e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Analytics</link> and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="a7d724fb-63f9-41e2-944e-23af461ec123" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) Support for the Azure Storage Services</link> for more information on CORS rules.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="a7d724fb-63f9-41e2-944e-23af461ec123" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) Support for the Azure Storage Services</link> for more information on CORS rules.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Set Queue Service Properties</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Set Queue Service Properties</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is recommended.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;account-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your storage account:
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;account-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your storage account:

trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.target: PUT

trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: Note that the URI must always include the forward slash (/) to separate the host name from the path and query portions of the URI.
trans-unit.target: Note that the URI must always include the forward slash (/) to separate the host name from the path and query portions of the URI.

trans-unit.source: In the case of this operation, the path portion of the URI is empty.
trans-unit.target: In the case of this operation, the path portion of the URI is empty.

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The combination of both query strings is required to set the storage service properties.
trans-unit.target: The combination of both query strings is required to set the storage service properties.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>timeout</parameterReference> parameter is expressed in seconds.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>timeout</parameterReference> parameter is expressed in seconds.

trans-unit.target: For version 2012-02-12 and earlier, the format of the request body is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Beginning with version 2013-08-15, you can call <languageKeyword>Set Queue Service Properties</languageKeyword> with one or more root elements specified in the request body.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with version 2013-08-15, you can call <languageKeyword>Set Queue Service Properties</languageKeyword> with one or more root elements specified in the request body.

trans-unit.source: The root elements include:
trans-unit.target: The root elements include:

trans-unit.source: It is no longer necessary to specify every root element on the request.
trans-unit.target: It is no longer necessary to specify every root element on the request.

trans-unit.source: If you omit a root element, the existing settings for the service for that functionality are preserved.
trans-unit.target: If you omit a root element, the existing settings for the service for that functionality are preserved.

trans-unit.source: However, if you do specify a given root element, you must specify every child element for that element.
trans-unit.target: However, if you do specify a given root element, you must specify every child element for that element.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements of the request body:
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements of the request body:

trans-unit.source: Element Name
trans-unit.target: Element Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Optional beginning with version 2013-08-15.
trans-unit.target: Optional beginning with version 2013-08-15.

trans-unit.source: Required for earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Required for earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Groups the Azure Analytics <system>Logging</system> settings.
trans-unit.target: Groups the Azure Analytics <system>Logging</system> settings.

trans-unit.source: Required for version 2012-02-12 and earlier.
trans-unit.target: Required for version 2012-02-12 and earlier.

trans-unit.source: Not applicable for version 2013-08-15 or later.
trans-unit.target: Not applicable for version 2013-08-15 or later.

trans-unit.source: Groups the Azure Analytics <system>Metrics</system> settings.
trans-unit.target: Groups the Azure Analytics <system>Metrics</system> settings.

trans-unit.source: The <system>Metrics</system> settings provide a summary of request statistics grouped by API in hourly aggregates for queues.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Metrics</system> settings provide a summary of request statistics grouped by API in hourly aggregates for queues.

trans-unit.source: Optional for version 2013-08-15 or later; not applicable for earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Optional for version 2013-08-15 or later; not applicable for earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Groups the Azure Analytics <system>HourMetrics</system> settings.
trans-unit.target: Groups the Azure Analytics <system>HourMetrics</system> settings.

trans-unit.source: The <system>HourMetrics</system> settings provide a summary of request statistics grouped by API in hourly aggregates for queues.
trans-unit.target: The <system>HourMetrics</system> settings provide a summary of request statistics grouped by API in hourly aggregates for queues.

trans-unit.source: Optional for version 2013-08-15 or later; not applicable for earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Optional for version 2013-08-15 or later; not applicable for earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Groups the Azure Analytics <system>MinuteMetrics</system> settings.
trans-unit.target: Groups the Azure Analytics <system>MinuteMetrics</system> settings.

trans-unit.source: The <system>MinuteMetrics</system> settings provide request statistics for each minute for queues.
trans-unit.target: The <system>MinuteMetrics</system> settings provide request statistics for each minute for queues.

trans-unit.source: For versions earlier than 2013-08-15, <system>MinuteMetrics</system> is not included in the response body.
trans-unit.target: For versions earlier than 2013-08-15, <system>MinuteMetrics</system> is not included in the response body.

trans-unit.source: Required if <system>Logging</system>, <system>Metrics</system>, <system>HourMetrics</system>, or <system>MinuteMetrics</system> settings are specified.
trans-unit.target: Required if <system>Logging</system>, <system>Metrics</system>, <system>HourMetrics</system>, or <system>MinuteMetrics</system> settings are specified.

trans-unit.source: The version of Storage Analytics to configure.
trans-unit.target: The version of Storage Analytics to configure.

trans-unit.source: Required if <system>Logging</system>, <system>Metrics</system>, <system>HourMetrics</system>, or <system>MinuteMetrics</system> settings are specified.
trans-unit.target: Required if <system>Logging</system>, <system>Metrics</system>, <system>HourMetrics</system>, or <system>MinuteMetrics</system> settings are specified.

trans-unit.source: Applies only to logging configuration.
trans-unit.target: Applies only to logging configuration.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether all delete requests should be logged.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether all delete requests should be logged.

trans-unit.source: Required if <system>Logging</system>, <system>Metrics</system>, <system>HourMetrics</system>, or <system>MinuteMetrics</system> settings are specified.
trans-unit.target: Required if <system>Logging</system>, <system>Metrics</system>, <system>HourMetrics</system>, or <system>MinuteMetrics</system> settings are specified.

trans-unit.source: Applies only to logging configuration.
trans-unit.target: Applies only to logging configuration.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether all read requests should be logged.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether all read requests should be logged.

trans-unit.source: Required if <system>Logging</system>, <system>Metrics</system>, <system>HourMetrics</system>, or <system>MinuteMetrics</system> settings are specified.
trans-unit.target: Required if <system>Logging</system>, <system>Metrics</system>, <system>HourMetrics</system>, or <system>MinuteMetrics</system> settings are specified.

trans-unit.source: Applies only to logging configuration.
trans-unit.target: Applies only to logging configuration.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether all write requests should be logged.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether all write requests should be logged.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether metrics are enabled for the Queue service.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether metrics are enabled for the Queue service.

trans-unit.source: If read-access geo-redundant replication is enabled, both primary and secondary metrics are collected.
trans-unit.target: If read-access geo-redundant replication is enabled, both primary and secondary metrics are collected.

trans-unit.source: If read-access geo-redundant replication is not enabled, only primary metrics are collected.
trans-unit.target: If read-access geo-redundant replication is not enabled, only primary metrics are collected.

trans-unit.source: Required only if metrics are enabled.
trans-unit.target: Required only if metrics are enabled.

trans-unit.source: Applies only to metrics configuration.
trans-unit.target: Applies only to metrics configuration.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether metrics should generate summary statistics for called API operations.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether metrics should generate summary statistics for called API operations.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether a retention policy is enabled for the storage service.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether a retention policy is enabled for the storage service.

trans-unit.source: Required only if a retention policy is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Required only if a retention policy is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the number of days that metrics or logging data should be retained.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the number of days that metrics or logging data should be retained.

trans-unit.source: All data older than this value will be deleted.
trans-unit.target: All data older than this value will be deleted.

trans-unit.source: The minimum value you can specify is <codeInline>1</codeInline>; the largest value is <codeInline>365</codeInline> (one year).
trans-unit.target: The minimum value you can specify is <codeInline>1</codeInline>; the largest value is <codeInline>365</codeInline> (one year).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The <system>Cors</system> element is supported for version 2013-08-15 or later.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Cors</system> element is supported for version 2013-08-15 or later.

trans-unit.source: Groups all CORS rules.
trans-unit.target: Groups all CORS rules.

trans-unit.source: Omitting this element group will not overwrite existing CORS settings.
trans-unit.target: Omitting this element group will not overwrite existing CORS settings.

trans-unit.source: CorsRule
trans-unit.target: CorsRule

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a CORS rule for the Queue service.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a CORS rule for the Queue service.

trans-unit.source: You can include up to five <system>CorsRule</system> elements in the request.
trans-unit.target: You can include up to five <system>CorsRule</system> elements in the request.

trans-unit.source: If no <system>CorsRule</system> elements are included in the request body, all CORS rules will be deleted, and CORS will be disabled for the Queue service.
trans-unit.target: If no <system>CorsRule</system> elements are included in the request body, all CORS rules will be deleted, and CORS will be disabled for the Queue service.

trans-unit.source: AllowedOrigins
trans-unit.target: AllowedOrigins

trans-unit.source: Required if <system>CorsRule</system> element is present.
trans-unit.target: Required if <system>CorsRule</system> element is present.

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of origin domains that will be allowed via CORS, or "*" to allow all domains.
trans-unit.target: A comma-separated list of origin domains that will be allowed via CORS, or "*" to allow all domains.

trans-unit.source: Limited to 64 origin domains.
trans-unit.target: Limited to 64 origin domains.

trans-unit.source: Each allowed origin can have up to 256 characters.
trans-unit.target: Each allowed origin can have up to 256 characters.

trans-unit.source: ExposedHeaders
trans-unit.target: ExposedHeaders

trans-unit.source: Required if <system>CorsRule</system> element is present.
trans-unit.target: Required if <system>CorsRule</system> element is present.

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of response headers to expose to CORS clients.
trans-unit.target: A comma-separated list of response headers to expose to CORS clients.

trans-unit.source: Limited to 64 defined headers and two prefixed headers.
trans-unit.target: Limited to 64 defined headers and two prefixed headers.

trans-unit.source: Each header can be up to 256 characters.
trans-unit.target: Each header can be up to 256 characters.

trans-unit.source: MaxAgeInSeconds
trans-unit.target: MaxAgeInSeconds

trans-unit.source: Required if <system>CorsRule</system> element is present.
trans-unit.target: Required if <system>CorsRule</system> element is present.

trans-unit.source: The number of seconds that the client/browser should cache a preflight response.
trans-unit.target: The number of seconds that the client/browser should cache a preflight response.

trans-unit.source: AllowedHeaders
trans-unit.target: AllowedHeaders

trans-unit.source: Required if <system>CorsRule</system> element exists.
trans-unit.target: Required if <system>CorsRule</system> element exists.

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of headers allowed to be part of the cross-origin request.
trans-unit.target: A comma-separated list of headers allowed to be part of the cross-origin request.

trans-unit.source: Limited to 64 defined headers and 2 prefixed headers.
trans-unit.target: Limited to 64 defined headers and 2 prefixed headers.

trans-unit.source: Each header can be up to 256 characters.
trans-unit.target: Each header can be up to 256 characters.

trans-unit.source: AllowedMethods
trans-unit.target: AllowedMethods

trans-unit.source: Required if <system>CorsRule</system> element exists.
trans-unit.target: Required if <system>CorsRule</system> element exists.

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of HTTP methods that are allowed to be executed by the origin.
trans-unit.target: A comma-separated list of HTTP methods that are allowed to be executed by the origin.

trans-unit.source: For Azure Storage, permitted methods are DELETE, GET, HEAD, MERGE, POST, OPTIONS or PUT.
trans-unit.target: For Azure Storage, permitted methods are DELETE, GET, HEAD, MERGE, POST, OPTIONS or PUT.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 202 (Accepted).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 202 (Accepted).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Response Header
trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the service.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation used for the response.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: Only the account owner may call this operation.
trans-unit.target: Only the account owner may call this operation.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The following restrictions and limitations apply to CORS rules in Azure Storage:
trans-unit.target: The following restrictions and limitations apply to CORS rules in Azure Storage:

trans-unit.source: A maximum of five rules can be stored.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of five rules can be stored.

trans-unit.source: The maximum size of all CORS rules settings on the request, excluding XML tags, should not exceed 2 KB.
trans-unit.target: The maximum size of all CORS rules settings on the request, excluding XML tags, should not exceed 2 KB.

trans-unit.source: The length of an allowed header, exposed header, or allowed origin should not exceed 256 characters.
trans-unit.target: The length of an allowed header, exposed header, or allowed origin should not exceed 256 characters.

trans-unit.source: Allowed headers and exposed headers may be either:
trans-unit.target: Allowed headers and exposed headers may be either:

trans-unit.source: Literal headers, where the exact header name is provided, such as <system>x-ms-meta-processed</system>.
trans-unit.target: Literal headers, where the exact header name is provided, such as <system>x-ms-meta-processed</system>.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 64 literal headers may be specified on the request.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 64 literal headers may be specified on the request.

trans-unit.source: Prefixed headers, where a prefix of the header is provided, such as <system>x-ms-meta-data*</system>.
trans-unit.target: Prefixed headers, where a prefix of the header is provided, such as <system>x-ms-meta-data*</system>.

trans-unit.source: Specifying a prefix in this manner allows or exposes any header that begins with the given prefix.
trans-unit.target: Specifying a prefix in this manner allows or exposes any header that begins with the given prefix.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of two prefixed headers may be specified on the request.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of two prefixed headers may be specified on the request.

trans-unit.source: The methods (or HTTP verbs) specified in the <system>AllowedMethods</system> element must conform to the methods supported by Azure storage service APIs.
trans-unit.target: The methods (or HTTP verbs) specified in the <system>AllowedMethods</system> element must conform to the methods supported by Azure storage service APIs.

trans-unit.source: Supported methods are DELETE, GET, HEAD, MERGE, POST, OPTIONS and PUT.
trans-unit.target: Supported methods are DELETE, GET, HEAD, MERGE, POST, OPTIONS and PUT.

trans-unit.source: Specifying CORS rules on the request is optional.
trans-unit.target: Specifying CORS rules on the request is optional.

trans-unit.source: If you call <languageKeyword>Set Queue Service Properties</languageKeyword> without specifying the <system>Cors</system> element in the request body, any existing CORS rules are maintained.
trans-unit.target: If you call <languageKeyword>Set Queue Service Properties</languageKeyword> without specifying the <system>Cors</system> element in the request body, any existing CORS rules are maintained.

trans-unit.source: To disable CORS, call <languageKeyword>Set Queue Service Properties</languageKeyword> with an empty CORS rules settings (<legacyItalic>i.e.,</legacyItalic> <codeInline>%%amp;lt;/Cors%%amp;gt;</codeInline>) and no inner CORS rules.
trans-unit.target: To disable CORS, call <languageKeyword>Set Queue Service Properties</languageKeyword> with an empty CORS rules settings (<legacyItalic>i.e.,</legacyItalic> <codeInline>%%amp;lt;/Cors%%amp;gt;</codeInline>) and no inner CORS rules.

trans-unit.source: This call deletes any existing rules, disabling CORS for the Queue service.
trans-unit.target: This call deletes any existing rules, disabling CORS for the Queue service.

trans-unit.source: All CORS rule elements are required if the <system>CorsRule</system> element is specified.
trans-unit.target: All CORS rule elements are required if the <system>CorsRule</system> element is specified.

trans-unit.source: The request will fail with error code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>) if any element is missing.
trans-unit.target: The request will fail with error code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>) if any element is missing.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with version 2013-08-15, XML settings elements will be optional so updating a specific element can be done by sending an XML that only contains the updated element and other settings will not be affected.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with version 2013-08-15, XML settings elements will be optional so updating a specific element can be done by sending an XML that only contains the updated element and other settings will not be affected.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about CORS rules and evaluation logic, see <link xlink:href="a7d724fb-63f9-41e2-944e-23af461ec123" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross-Origin Resource Sharing Support for the Azure Storage Services</link>.
